name: kinetics psychokinesis or telekinesis cinematography

name: collaborate elaborate laborious

name: lactate lactose lactic acid.
trans: lact/o-milk; lactate - to give milk, nurse; lactose - the sugar contained in milk; lactic acid.

name: bilateral unilateral
trans: later-side; bilateral - of or involving two sides; unilateral - affecting one side of something.

name: leukemia leukocyte leucine

name: lexicology alexia illegal
trans: lex-word, law, reading; lexicology - the study and history of words; alexia -loss of the ability to read; illegal - not authorized by the official rules or laws.

name: liberate libertine liberty
trans: liber-free; liberate - to set free; libertine - a person with a free, wild lifestyle; liberty - freedom.

name: linguist multilingual linguine

name: liposuction lipase lipoid

name: apatite granite monolith

name: dislocate location relocate

name: logic monologue analogy

name: eloquent loquacious elocution

name: illuminate lumen
trans: lumin-light; illuminate - to fill with light; lumen - unit measuring light.

name: lunar lunarscape lunatic
trans: lun/a/i-moon; lunar - relating to the moon; lunarscape - the surface of the moon; lunatic - insane (as if driven mad by the moon).

name: magnify magnificent magnate

name: malcontent malaria malicious

name: maneuver manual manuscript
trans: man/i/u-hand; maneuver - to move by hand; manual - done with the hands; manuscript - a book written by hand.

name: command demand mandate

name: bibliomania egomania maniac an insane person.

name: marina maritime submarine aquamarine

name: maternal maternity matriarch

name: maximal maximize maximum

name: medieval medium mediocre

name: megalopolis megaphone megastructure

name: melancholy melanoma melodrama
trans: melan/o-black; melancholy - a state of dark emotions; melanoma - malignant dark tumor of the skin; melodrama - a dark, pathetic drama.

name: commemorate memorial memory: an ability to retain knowledge or an individual's stock of retained knowledge.
trans: memor/i-remember; commemorate - to honor the memory of, as by a ceremony; memorial - related to remembering a person or event; memory: an ability to retain knowledge or an individual's stock of retained knowledge.

name: immerge or immerse submerge to dip something completely into wate.r
trans: merge,-dip, dive; immerge or immerse - to put or dip something into a liquid; submerge to dip something completely into wate.r

trans: meso-middle; Mesoamerica - Middle America; meson - elementary particle with a mass between an electron and a proton.

name: metaphysics metamorphosis metastasis

trans: meter,-measure; audiometer- an instrument that measures hearing acuteness; chronometer- an instrument that measures time; metric - measured.

name: microbe microchip microscope

name: midriff midterm midway

name: immigrant migrant migration

name: millimeter millibar milliliter

name: mini minuscule minutiae

name: misbehave misprint misnomer

name: immobilize mobile mobility

name: monochromat monologue monotheism

trans: mot, mov-move; motion - the act of moving; motivate - to move someone to action; promote to move someone forward; removable - able to be taken or carried away.

name: multicolored multimedia multitasking
trans: multi-many, more than one or two; multicolored - having many colors; multimedia - using a range of media; multitasking - doing many things at once.

name: immutable mutant mutate
trans: mut-change; immutable - not changing; mutant - an organism that has undergone change; mutate - to undergo a change.

name: myocardium myasthenia myosin

name: innate natal natural

name: neoclassic neonatal
trans: neo-new, recent; neoclassic - a revival of classic form, neocolonialism - the indirect ("new") economical and political control of a region by a more powerful foreign power; neonatal - a newborn child, especially the first few weeks.

name: nephritis nephrotomy nephron
trans: nephr/o-kidney; nephritis - inflammation of the kidneys; nephrotomy - surgical incision of a kidney; nephron - a single, excretory unit in the kidney.

name: neuralgia neurologist neurotic
trans: neur/o-nerve; neuralgia - pain along a nerve; neurologist - doctor specializing in the nerves; neurotic - mental disorder that usually does not include an impaired perception of reality.

name: misnomer nominal nominate
trans: nom/in-name; misnomer - an error in naming a person or thing; nominal - being something in name only but not in reality; nominate - to name for election or appointment, to designate.

name: nondescript nonfiction nonsense
trans: non-no, not, without; nondescript - with no special characteristics; nonfiction - true, real, not made-up; nonsense - without sense.

name: notable notarize annotate
trans: not-mark; notable - marked as worthy of attention; notarize - to certify a signature on a legal document; annotate - to add remarks.

name: announce denounce enunciate
trans: noun,-declare; announce - to declare in public; denounce - to proclaim harsh criticism; enunciate - to speak or declare something clearly.

name: innovate novelty novice renovate

trans: numer-number; enumerate - to name a number of items on a list; numerology - the study of magical uses of numbers; numerous - a large number.

trans: ocu-eye; binoculars - lens device for seeing distances; monocula - relating to one eye; oculist - an eye doctor.

name: deodorant  malodorous  odoriferous
trans: odor -smell, scent; deodorant - a substance that helps prevent body odor; malodorous - having a terribly bad smell; odoriferous- something that bears or diffuses a scent

name: omnipotent omniscient omnivorous eating all foods.
trans: omni-all; omnipotent - with all the power; omniscient - knowing all things; omnivorous eating all foods.

name: optic optician autopsy

name: optimal optimize optimum

name: orthodontist orthopedic orthography

name: overconfident overstock overexcited

name: oxymoron oxidize

name: parachute parasol

name: paternal paternity patriarch

name: circumspect retrospective spectator

name: constellation interstellar stellar

name: sum summation summit

name: technology technocracy technologically
trans: techno-technique, skill; technology - the practical application of knowledge; technocracy - rule of technology; technologically - characterized by technology.

name: telephone telescope television telecommuting
trans: tel/e/o-far, distant, complete; telephone - a device to talk to a distant person; telescope - a device to view distant objects; television - a device to receive pictures from afar; telecommuting - working remotely, bridging the distance via virtual devices.

name: contemporary temporal temporary
trans: temp/or-time; contemporary- existing at the same time; temporal - relating to time; temporary - lasting for a limited time.

name: continent detention
trans: ten, tin, tent-hold; continent- serving to restrain or limit; detention-  the act or fact of detaining, tenacious- having parts or elements strongly adhering to each other

name: attrition detritus trite
trans: ter, trit-rub; attrition-  the act of rubbing together or wearing down; detritus- a product of disintegration or wearing away; trite- used or occurring so often as to have lost interest, freshness, or force

name: determine terminate exterminate
trans: term/ina-end, limit; determine - to find something out at the end of an investigation; terminate - to end; exterminate - to destroy or get rid of completely.

name: extraterrestrial terrain territory
trans: terr/a/i-land, earth; extraterrestrial - existing outside the earth; terrain - ground or land; territory - an area of land.

name: tetrapod tetrarchy tetrose
trans: tetra-four; tetrapod - having 4 legs; tetrarchy - government by 4 rulers; tetrose - a monosaccharide with four carbon atoms.

name: bibliotheca theme thesis
trans: the-put; bibliotheca-  a list or catalog of books; theme- a proposition for discussion or argument; thesis- a dissertation embodying results of original research and especially substantiating a specific view

name: monotheism polytheism theology
trans: the/o-god; monotheism - belief in one god; polytheism - worshiping more than one god; theology - the study of religion, god, etc.

name: thermal thermos thermostat
trans: therm/o-heat; thermal - relating to heat; thermos - an insulated jar that keeps heat in; thermostat - a device that controls heat.

name: contortion distort retort
trans: tort-twist; contortion - a twisted shape or position; distort - to alter the shape or condition of; retort - reply in a manner that is supposed to change the effect of something previously said.

name: detoxification toxic toxicology intoxicated
trans: tox-poison; detoxification - the process of removing poisons; toxic - poisonous; toxicology - the study of poisons; intoxicated - influenced by drugs.

name: attract distract tractor
trans: tract-pull, drag; attract - to pull objects nearer; distract - to drag attention away from something; tractor - a motor vehicle that pulls things.

name: transcontinental transfer transport
trans: trans-across,beyond, through; transcontinental - across the continent; transfer - to move from one place to another; transport - to carry something across a space.

name: triangle triathlon tricycle
trans: tri-three, once in every three, ; triangle - a figure with 3 sides and 3 angles; triathlon - an athletic contest with 3 events; tricycle - a 3-wheeI vehicle with pedals.

name: ultrahigh ultramodern ultrasonic
trans: ultra-beyond, extreme, more than; ultrahigh - extremely high; ultramodern - more modern than anything else; ultrasonic - sound waves beyond human hearing.

name: unabridged unfair unfriendly
trans: un-not,opposite of, lacking; unabridged - not shortened; unfair - opposite of fair; unfriendly - lacking friendliness.

name: unicycle unilateral unique unison
trans: uni-one, single; unicycle - a vehicle with one wheel; unilateral - decided by only one person or nation; unique - the only one of its kind; unison - as one voice.

name: suburb urban urbanology
trans: urb-city; suburb - residential area on the edge of a city; urban - relating to a city; urbanology - the study of city life.

name: evacuate vacant vacation
trans: vac-empty; evacuate - to empty a dangerous place; vacant - empty, not occupied; vacation - a time without work.

name: circumvent convention intervene
trans: ven/t-come; circumvent - to go around or bypass restrictions; convention - a gathering or assembly of people with a common interest; intervene - to come between.

name: veracious veracity verify
trans: ver/I-truth; veracious - truthful, honest; veracity - the truth; verify - to make sure that something is true.

name: verbalize adverb proverb
trans: verb-word; verbalize - to put into words; adverb - a word relating to a verb; proverb - a short saying that expresses a well-known truth.

name: reverse introvert version controversy
trans: vers,-turn; reverse - to turn around; introvert - being turned towards the inside; version - a variation of an original; controversy - a conversation in which positions are turned against each other.

name: vice-acting vice-president
trans: vice-acting in place of, ; vice-president - the person next in rank to the president

name: evident clearly seen
trans: vid-see; evident clearly seen

name: convince invincible victory
trans: vince,-conquer; convince - to win someone over; invincible - not able to be conquered; victory - the conquest of an enemy.

name: vision envision evident
trans: vis, vid-see; vision - the ability to see; envision - to picture in the mind; evident - clearly visible.

name: revival vital vivacious
trans: viv/i-live, life; revival - the act of bringing back to life; vital - pertaining to live; vivacious - high-spirited and full of life.

name: advocate equivocate vocalize
trans: voc/i-voice, call; advocate - to speak in favor of; equivocate - to use misleading language that could be interpreted two different ways; vocalize - to produce with your voice.

name: benevolent volition
trans: vol/i/u-wish, will; benevolent - showing good will and kindness; volition - the act of making a choice or decision, voluntary - resulting from your own free will.

name: carnivorous voracious devour
trans: vor,-eat; carnivorous - meat-eating; voracious - desiring or eating food in great quantities; devour - to eat quickly.

name: xanthium xanthochromia xanthogenic
trans: xanth-yellow; xanthium- a genus of coarse and rough or spiny herbs; xanthochromia- yellowish discoloration (as of the skin or cerebrospinal fluid); xanthogenic

name: xenophobic xenogenesis xenophile
trans: xen/o-foreign; xenophobic - afraid of foreigners; xenogenesis - the creation of offspring that is completely different from either parent; xenophile - attracted to foreigners.

name: xerophyte xerography xeric
trans: xer/o/I-dry; xerophyte - a plant that grows in dry climate; xerography - a dry photocopying process; xeric - requiring small amounts of moisture.

name: xylocarp xyloid xylophone
trans: xyl-wood; xylocarp; xyloid- resembling wood; xylophone-an organ percussion stop of similar tone quality

name: zoology zooid zooplankton
trans: zo/o-animal life; zoology - study of animals; zooid - resembling an animal; zooplankton - minute floating aquatic animals.

name: zygote zygomorphic
trans: zyg/o-pair; zygote - a cell formed by the union of two gametes and the organism developing from that; zygomorphic - pertaining to organisms that can be divided into symmetrical halves along one axis only.
